info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:39PM EDT until July 03 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN NELSON AND CENTRAL ALBEMARLE COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF CHARLOTTESVILLE... At 339 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles south of Wintergreen to 8 miles north of Schuyler to 7 miles southwest of Lake Monticello, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Charlottesville, Crozet, Shipman, Schuyler, Wintergreen, Nellysford, Ivy, Scottsville, Esmont, Lovingston, North Garden, Covesville, Yancey Mills, Tyro, Flordon, Jonesboro, Scott Stadium, Faber, Massies Mill and Bryant. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
